name: Primal Carnage
description: Unleash your inner dinosaur! Primal Carnage is an online multiplayer shooter that immerses its players in skilled PVP combat. Fight as man or beast in savage class-based deathmatches and a tense objective-oriented escape mode!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP, Vista, 7 Processor:Intel Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or AMD Athlon X2 4800+ Memory:3 GB RAM Graphics:ATI 3850HD 512 MB or NVIDIA GeForce 8800 GT 512MB DirectXÂ®:9.0c Hard Drive:4 GB HD space Other Requirements:Broadband Internet connection

reviews.review_text: Absolutely one of my favorite games of all time. This game has everything you could ask for; Dinosaurs and Guns. There is no game like this. It is extremely fun to play with your friends and the different game modes and maps makes it a game you keep coming back to. The characters feel very unique and are all fun to play, teamwork is greatly rewarded and it's easy to get into.   If you're looking for a dinosaur game then THIS IS IT. If you're just looking for an entertaining multiplayer experience, this won't let you down either.   Become the enourmous T-rex. Gaze upon your prey and stomp your way through the world as you unleash your mighty roar. Rip him to pieces between your jaws.
This game was made for my inner child. He's all FFFFFWHHAAAAA!!!
A game turned into a role-playing simulator for mentally unstable children.
Humans - Shoot dinos in the face. Dinosaurs - Eat/bite/claw humans in the face.  Pretty damn entertaining.

This game is an absolute masterpiece.   It might be quite buggy and limited in terms of gameplay, but I have never enjoyed a game more than Primal Carnage.  It is a lot like Team Fortress 2 but without the annoying community, hackers and general mediocre game experience. Also it has dinosaurs, so there's that.  The sequel coming out on December 3rd (Primal Carnage: Extinction) is going to fix the bugs and add tonnes of new content. The only reason not to buy Primal Carnage is that the sequel is coming out very soon.  I give this game a solid 10/10 for how much I have enjoyed it. Thank you Lukewarm Media for making this game. I just hope that Circle 5 Studios and Pub Games can live up to their predecessor.
1/ No AI or offline mode. 2/ Server is laggy and too few.
loving it. it's addictive too. gotta admit it's mega fun being a t-rex or flying as a ptera

Addicting game that gets alittle to intense during battle. Love the combat and the details the dinosaurs have!  Pros:  -Teams switch every round so everyone gets a chance to play dinosaur  -The 2 gamemodes available are quite fun and challenging: a Team Deathmatch mode and an objective based mode called 'Get to the Chopper' -Quite a few species of dinosaur, including Dilophosaurus, Spinosaurus, T.rex and a hybrid raptor called 'Novaraptor' -The human classes are both fun and challenging  Cons: -Some attacks feel overpowered, and as the game's not being updated, these will never be fixed. -Graphics can feel exceptionally mediocre on anything but 'High' settings

Being mostly a normal player of this game I must say it never gets old. :) I seriously enjoy the fact that there is finally a dinosaur game that is not a waste of time and money!  This game may be buggy at some points, but all in all it is a whole lot of fun and even more fun, hilarious, and chaotic when you have a few friends to play along. I am known on YouTube for my community Let's Plays on this video game and I tell you, I've never had so much fun or met such amazing people in my entire life!  I recommend you get this game, get it for your friends, and make memories!
A nice game which has sadly to many bugs and is no longer being updated because they are planning a recode which people will have to buy so don't buy this game

This game is a ton of fun. It's probably one of the better dinosaur games out there, and I really like playing it. The only problem I have is that it isn't as fun when you're not playing a dinosaur. I'd really like to see a Dino vs Dino mode, and I think it'd help the game out tremendously since the playing a human just plain sucks. All in all it's a pretty alright for just 15 dollars. Pick this up if you like being a giant T-Rex who gets to eat a tremendous amount of people.

Fantastic online multiplayer game. Great gameplay and graphics. Mabye there should be more characters to be chosen of. Also there are not so many maps and game modes. But at the end it is game that's worth of buying.  Verdict: 8 / 10

This is far the most best dinosaur shooter game there is on steam with the game having ten unique classes and with great gameplay from every one who has played this game primal carnage i recommend this game for a fan of shooting dinosaur games i played this it was amazing with a classes having there advantages and disadvantages in the game what i like about primal carnage is that what you can do with any class if your experienced enough to pull off the impossible kills in the game this is my favorite game on steam and always will be

If you like the Turok franchise, this is up your alley (minus the story). You shoot dinosaurs and you eat people. That's about it. The classes are fairly balanced. The graphics are decent. The sound is fine. It's a fps shooter with gameplay more similar to left4dead or team fortress 2 than say COD and Battlefield. If this game were $60, it would be very mediocre, but for $15 it's not bad at all.  7.5 of 10

A very promising game, extremely well balanced and very fun to play. Multiplayer is divided into classes, 5 human, 5 dinosaurs, and the gameplay is fast, furious and will keep you on your toes regardless of your specie/class.   The maps are cleverly designed, with some being more human friendly, and some more dino friendly. This game will give you the dose of adrenaline you are looking for, and it also manages to be a very tense gameplay experience, as a human you always feel you are being hunted, and as a dinosaur you feel like you are stalking your prey.   If you have watched the Jurassic park series of films more times than you can count, and you always wondered how it would be like to be a T-Rex, now is your chance. Primal Carnage delivers on both ends, it's fun to play as a dino and as a human.   The Good  -Five classes for each species, each influencing how you play the game -Get to the choppah mode adds one more dinosaur class (spinosaurus) -Servers are usually full, and perform well (low lag usually)  The Bad  -Non existing story (some people might be thrown off because of that)  -No single player mode   7.5/10
I strongly recommend this game. It has a few kinds of servers, making gameplay quite fun.

This game is flat out incredible. I, myself, have spent well over 50 hours on this game, I think somewhere around 70, to be honest. I've loved all of them. The game is immersive, the background music as humans makes some of the maps extremely suspenseful. And there's nothing you'll love more than the thrill of hiding from an angry t-rex or spino and having your entire screen shake as they get closer. I've played a few other dinosaur games, but none have come close to the experience of Primal Carnage. I recommend this game to anyone who can press buttons and click a mouse. (everyone, for the most part) The feeling of being a Spinosaurus or T-rex makes you feel untouchable. Yeah, pathfinders are overpowered, but whatever. It feels so good to be a 10 ton behemoth who instakills everything it touches.
Good game, i love it, but the game is dying.
Great Game !!! Got it for cheap !!! 11/10

All in all, it's a very enjoyable experience! As long as humans and dinos stick together in teams, the game can be challengingly fun. It also takes quite a bit of time to master some of the dinos, so you can't just go charging into a group of humans thinking you're invincible.  I do criticize the inability to aim down the sights on some of the human weapons (e.g. Commando's machine gun). It's pretty fun anyways!

A game based around simply pure fun. If you like dinosaurs and guns, try this out. Dinosaurs haven't held up too well in the gaming industry since the last Turok game, and there have been many games trying to bring it back to life, so far the closest one in my opinion is Primal Carnage. The game itself has excellent graphics, renderring beautiful enviroments, and whilst the gameplay itself is limited and quite buggy in times, it is great fun to charge at humans as a giant T-rex, gulping up helpless platyers who run in your path. Even playing the humans can be quite fun. My biggest complaints about this game so far seem to be the map sizes, which can perform imbalances towards the humans as players form large groups which take a lot of cannon fodder to break apart, as most dinosaur players are simply too scattered around the place to intervene.   Not to mention when you're playing a game where a group of humans are fighting against swarms of dinosaurs, there's a hell of a lot of over-the-top stuff to laugh about.  The average price in this game isn't too bad, though I'd wait for a steam sale before buying it, especially since I consider the skin DLC's to offer some pretty cool dino-skins. On sales I'd reccomend this game for any dino-lover who's looking for a good time from the more competitive games out there.

I might be a little biased since I loved dinosaurs as a kid, but I'll try and break it down as unbiased as possible. Primal Carnage is a team-based PvP game with, you guessed it, Dinos and Humans. The only plot is that there's an island where Dinosaurs have been reborn (Jurassic Park gone wrong?) and humans get trapped on the island. The classes are pretty basic, each one has a main and secondary attack, along with Dinos getting a roar ability which buffs other Dinos. The concept of gigantic Tyranosaurs and Spinosaurs isn't as overpowered as you might think, and they pulled it off pretty well, although obviously if you got someone good playing he'll probably wreck your team.  There isn't a big community left, mind you, but it isn't hard finding a full server if you want to play a couple rounds of Dino smashing or Human stompin'. It's worth the $8, but if you can pick it up on a sale go for it. It's freakin' Primal Carnage.

To create primal carnage: 1.Take your generic FPS shooter which has become a bit bland. 2.Add several playable creatures from a land long forgotten. 3.Make sure they have interesting maps to kill things on. 4.Add victims for them to devour. 5.Make each class, human or dino, unique and different to play each time. 6.Finally give your prehistoric killing machines the ability to change their skins and you have....  THE BEST DINO THEMED GAME AROUND. *cough* ark still better *cough*

while other reviews just say 'there is a sequel coming soon, don't buy it', i will actually review the game itself.   first, the graphics and animation. the graphics looks like they were taken from source, and if i didn't know it was made with unreal engine, i wouldv'e think it is a source game. animations are unrealistic.  gameplay: the gameplay is fine, but nothing special. you actually can't throw grenades, even if your character description says you can, because you have only 3 buttons for abbilities: melee, normal attack, and alternate attack, and for some reason the chainsaw (for pyro) is not a melee but an alternate attack. also, it is hard to get off the ground as the flying dino. and no, this doesn't feel like it is like this for balance reasons. it is here because the developers did bad work. also the game is completely unbalanced and there is no team auto-balance like in AAA TVT (Team Vs. Team) shooters  also, i got 2 (!) achievments that i wasn't supposed to get, which shows you how this game is broken.

Full honesty mode: Great game, great dinosaur gameplay, just a bit unpolished in terms of movement. It is in no way balanced at the moment and the server browser is the worst I have seen in a long time. That being said, it is still very fun to play, even when playing as a team of unorganized humans being torn to shreds by a mosh pit of dinos.   Needs a lot of work, but assuming this is going to get it, and not die in the process, then I would say it's a good buy during any sale in it's current state.

This game is pretty darn fun, a game that isn't afraid to break the standard FPS affair, with dinosaurs! On a VERY basic level, this game is similar to Dino D-Day or Natural Selection, but the pacing is what makes this game unique. Each class and race has its own gameplay style, which adds a lot of depth to the game.  Built on the award winning Unreal engine, this game looks good, feels good, and the additional updates overtime can only make this game better.  You'll be dino-sore if you don't pick this one up!

The game is rough around the edges, but it gets right with what it needs to do. And it provides a really fun, pretty original multiplayer FPSer. Where else can you pick up other players and hurl them to their doom? Or stomp on them as a T-Rex? It reminds me of the old multiplayer mods of the past, taking a neat concept and just going for it.

Spent quite a few hours in the game recently and thought Id post my thoughts on the current version (1.3) While yes it does have issues that are likely to frustrate many players, the overall game and the challenge of it more then make up for those frustrations for me and it is incredibly fun to play and even just to explore all the mechanics of it. The core issue in the game itself is its balencing. The balencing is unequal between the dinos and humans, and goes against what you would expect. Classes that should do high damage dont, classes that should have low defense have strong, and similar issues along those lines. There are a lot of tricks to get around these problems that you will quickly learn by playing the game on various maps and learning techniques you can use to help overcome the bad balencing. Otherwise, technically the game runs very well, there are a few of the usual Unreal Engine errors, but certainly nothing game breaking or enjoyment stopping. The game feels VERY smooth to control, and I don't get any motion sickness like I usually do with FPS games, although it is worth noting that setting up a controller is incredibly difficult and not doable from just in game.  So yes while it does have a few issues I find the game itself incredibly enjoyable. The satisfaction of taking out a Rex, or dealing with a bouncy raptor is great, the same as you get as a dino when you manage to sneak up on a human and kill them or set up a run to do mass damage to a group at once. Turning around and seeing a dino charging at you is terrifying, helped by the great sense of scale that the devs have used model wise, and being killed across the map by a human with great aim really keeps you on your toes as a dino. While its not the most spectaular looking game, the graphics and assets they have used work very well together. Flora moves when you touch it, which means keeping your eyes open is very helpful, and the maps are well spaced, and often have unique balencing across various areas of the map itself. There is also a nice variety of map styles that you can play, if you can find servers using them. I do highly recommend the game, and it is great deal of fun, although if the balencing is likely to extremely frustrate you, you might be better off waiting for the v2.0 thats being worked on.

Primal Carnage has a low frame rate at first, but by turning down graphics a bit, the game works smoothly. Graphics 7/10 no particular reasons. Gameplay is really fun especially if your a dinosaur. But the only other problem is that if your a human your chances of winning a match are really low compared to the dinosaurs who thrash the humans. For the relatively cheap price the game is brilliant! I would definitely recommend it to you if you like PVP styled battles. I would not pay the extra Â£10 for the later version, primal carnage extinction, as the original is just as good. If you buy the game I hope you enjoy playing it as I have done!

This game seems to be a 'in the moment' type of game. At first you will be trying to get used to the feel of the game. After a couple of hours, you will get the hang of it and start enjoying yourself. Then 2 weeks later, Payday the heist goes on sale and you start to regret your decision.  The thing is, this is not a (really) bad game. The unbalanced cluster f**k matches are really fun. But the game is flawed and there is simply no longer support for it. I have found games that are better than this for free. Tremulous is a great game, for example. It is similar to Primal Carnage, except it's aliens vs humans.  I am starting to loose my train of thought for this review, So I will simply give a quick rundown about this game. Although flawed, it can be very enjoyable. The fact that this game is no longer supported, does hurt it's playability. You won't have a hard time finding players online, but the numbers are starting to decrease.   I can't really recommend it at full price, but buy it on sale and you will enjoy yourself.
It's like this game has no animations. Enemies just sort of float around while turning.

Primal Carnage is a game where you either play as human or dinosaur trying to complete different objectives:  Presentation: Being build in what I assume to be UE4, particles, motion blur, etc. are extremely good. However, I feel like the models could be a bit better. Textures (except for the ground) look really good.  Sound design: There's not much music in here, but the game sounds extremely good, from amazing shotgun sounds to scientifically accurate dinosaur roars.  Maps: Maps are absolutely amazing, period.  Gameplay: You either play as a human in first person, or a dinosaur in third person. Gameplay needs some tweaking. The character with the shotgun is extremely OP along with the pyro, but you'll enjoy the game nonetheless.  Cons: I initally found this game annoying, but you just have to get into the game before realizing how fun it is. The learning curve is also extremely steep. So I would recommend looking things up  Verdict: The game is cheap (I even won it for free in a giveaway) and fun, I really recommend this title.  Primal Carnage gets an 8/10

The controls are clunky at best, the game lags terribly no matter what setting you put it on or how fast your internet runs, and the glitches are consistant and never ending. Barebones is a generous word for this game. It's a team based multiplayer game in the vein of Team Fortress 2, but where one side almost always wins. But after playing a few matches, you'll start to realize something: There's no point.   There is xp, but there's no leveling up, no unlockable items, no random drops, no different weapons, skins, or maps (unless you pay for them). There's nothing to do after about half an hour, and no real reason to continue. I've heard the sequel improves these things but I've never played it (called Primal Carnage: Extinction, btw).

This is the first game I ever got on steam, that was 2 years ago. I have nothing bad to say about the game! It is very fun and fast paced. If your a dinosaur fanatic like me this will be your favorite game!

I originallly hated this game because the dinos overpowered the humans in this game. But going back to it, I found it to be quite fun. Especially when you're a human. This game is a multiplayer only PvP game(which is a shame because a campaign would be a nice addition). On one team, you control the humans who are capturing points in order to escape to the helicopter. On the other team you control dinosaurs where you try to stop the humans from escaping. Each class has unique weapons and abilities they can use to a certain advantage. You must use these and come up with tactics to use with those abilities and weapons. Plus, there is no extra weapons, so you won't be overpowered by someone else. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 8.5/10 It's a very good game. You should think about buying it sometime. And trust me it's worth it.

TL;DR Please do NOT buy this game, even if it's on sale (unless you want to waste a couple bucks).  I know it looks tempting to buy this game when it's on sale (it's on sale like every other day), and even more so if you are a dinosaur lover like me. But, please, do NOT buy this game, because the multiplayer has literally NEVER worked for me; I did everything: verify the integrity of the game cache, restart steam, delete local content, redownload it, etc. Either something is wrong with my computer, or (I am certain that this is the answer) no one is playing online. Furthermore, I checked the multiplayer servers every day for about a month and voila! Nothing. On the other hand, I did have a bit of fun playing by myself trying out the different characters on the different maps, which all had somewhat interesting characteristics, especially the hilariously bad voiceacting for the humans, but the game, as expected, got boring after that with no other real people to play with. If you want a game that will satisfy your hunger for a dinosaur-related FPS, I'd suggest Dino D-Day. Not sure how good Primal Carnage: Extinction is either but I didn't buy it because of the lack of trust I feel for the developers. Oh and I hope this game wins my custom Steam award 'The Multiplayer Never Worked' lmao. So yeah just get Dino D-Day.

Here is a quote from their website for their new update:  Why Is Primal Carnage: Extinction Not Free?  Circle 5 and Pub Games originally planned to deliver Primal Carnage: Extinction as a free gift to everyone who purchased the original Primal Carnage as a way to satisfy Lukewarmâs statements that this would be a free update. Ultimately Extinction increased dramatically in scope and at this point the project is far over budget. We canât survive and pay our staff without charging something for Extinction. Customers who purchased the original Primal Carnage before November 20th, 2014, will receive a coupon for 85% off of Extinctionâs $20 launch price which will bring the cost of Extinction to $3 for customers who bought the original Primal Carnage. While we do apologize that we couldnât release this game for free, weâve made a decision that better supports our ability to deliver ongoing content to the game and in turn delivers more to our community in the long term. A lot of people have devoted a lot of time to building this game, and we fully stand by its value.  So yeah... Take that how you will. They need the money to support themselves, and people who already bought the game get a MAJOR price reduction. Quit whining you selfish gits.

There's a lot of carnage in this game. Most of it being primal. Aside from the lag issues with the game and the bad clipping with some of the dinosaurs. The dinos happen to be kind of OP compared to the humans. The dinos sometimes struggle to eat when you spam the eat button. A T-rex can flip a pteranodon like a burger in the air, killing or injuring it because it screws with your wings and ability to fly. Some places can be heavily camped by either faction making the game slower or frustrating. Ammo and health boxes have â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥ collision problems and latency issues previously mentioned make it harder to activate them. Spawns in some game modes with constantly spawn you into death and then all of a sudden you're miles from the action with a close combat class. Distribution of carcasses or health and ammo in some modes favour dinos over the humans. But all that said it's such a bad game that it's fun. At least 10 times better than that sucky dino hoarde thing steam is really trying to persuade people to buy by giving out a free demo of it every month.

A all round great game. Th lack of progression can cause the game to feel lacking, but they have nailed the controls of the dinosaurs. Some of my favourite moments are being a raptor and hiding in a bush only to leap out and pounce on top of a unsuspecting human. well worth the price. 10/10

do not buy this game. it will no longer recieve updates and has been left in an aweful state. i have a little more than 900 hours in this game. and this is what i have to say.  -horridly unbalanced.  -there are mods and console commands that ruin the game for others while making others more powerful -hidden classes that are overpowered. -i have never had more rage from me and my friends than any other game.  -many much hackers.   BUT. their is a new game called primal carnage: extinction.  after only 200 hours i was convinced.   -getting constant updates. monthly or bi-monthly -less hackers. -better balance -more content/classes/weapons/maps -lower graphic requirement (good for people with low end computers) -and more features soon to be added like swimming/herbivorus dinos/and new modes.   please do the community a favor and go get the new primal carnage. its much better.

Incrediably imbalanced, lack of content, No progression No balance.  Heres the story..... there was this random dock invaded by dinos (this is the only map played online). On this dock someone had jsut delivered a massive supply of custom built kelvar suits wierdly designed as if they may be for dinosaurs of all sizes, there were also crates of lazer claws and dino steroids. After the dino army conquered the island the rest of the world ignored it. Then america sent its four most steroid typical secret agents to fights the dinos.   Lead by the souless ginger pyromanics who ahd recently fulled his flame thrower with the worlds cheapest and watered down fuel. He summoned his four other team mates black steroidtype a big black man full of steroids incapable of finding a shirt that fits, where his hilariously poor spray and prey aim fails him his chest will surely fend off the dino teeth.  he then called apon token steriotypical blond nerd researcher sniper character, armed with a token tank gun and 22 caliber sniper for hunting rabbits to feed to the dinos. She insisted her nerdy hunter themed ally must also come armed with his harmless tiny net launcher capable of slightly covered some smaller dinos faces. It was then time to call upon thier tracker the most racially sterotipical character other than the black rapper/soldier. Token indian chief guy.... Armed with thier hilariously effective weapons the team traveled via cargo ship to the dino infested island with no plan, no objectives and no chance of ever winning against the heavily militaried dino force... Luckily for them the developers never released the 'dinosaurs have miniguns and grenade launchers' DLC.

Primal Carnage is a great romp of fun!! If you love dinos and can't help but get a thrill out of taking a bite out of the humans, then you'll certainly have a blast with this game! The designs and overall gameplay on dino side is quite a bit fun and each class meshes well with each other.  On human side same thing. The classes are all quite diverse and fun to play as each suits a certain role nicely! It can take some getting used to at first, but once you have a hang on things then you'll be hunting with the best of them!  The only few negative things I have to say about Primal Carnage is that the controls can sometimes be a tad bit wonky. Easy to customize to suit your playstyle of course, but every now and again you might be hung up on the environment or when trying to heal or snag a weapons cache and.....one missed moment could screw up your chances of survival quite a bit. The match time length is also a HUGE pain sitting at about 40mins per round. :( If that was alterable that'd be a big boost to the functionality and morale of players for the game. Also, it'd be nice if the game could still get updated from time to time. I know Primal Carnage: Extinction gets a lot more attention these days, but it'd be nice for this original to still get some focus and tweaks every now and again.   Other than that, I absolutely love the game! I'm always a bit of an achievement enthusiast and theres quite a few for Primal Carnage that I definitley like as they'll be fun and challenging to acquire! Anyways! So much fun, and after seeing and enjoying the hype for Jurassic World, there's a good chance most everyone playing with you is out to have a great deal of fun as well! :D So come on and take a chance with us!

Game needs more team work, shame the devs gave on it too.

Apart from some balance issues and lack of in-game server options for hosts (at least that I could find) it's a pretty fun game. New players will likely get owned pretty hard if playing with veterans though. Very fun with a handful of friends playing cat & mouse.  Pterodactyls are pretty tough to figure out, but can end up being rather OP.  The raptor jump is awesomely fun, but the range miiiiiiight be pushing it a little.  Sniper/scientist regenerates stamina quite quickly, and argh, the white hat is great at giving away position.  T-Rex is just amusingly fun though scary how silently it can sneak up on a human at a full run.  tl;dr: Some balance issues but well worth it.

I absolutely recommend this game.  So...I know what you're going to say: 'But Sanborn, you always trick me into spending $5 on some game that I'll play once, or only has players because of a Steam sale'.  I'm being 100% with you when I say that this game is worth the cash you're about to spend. It's my favorite game right now and is an incredibly fun human vs. dinosaurs online shooter. It also has an excellent UT style attack/defend mode and the gameplay from dinosaur to dinosaur or human to human class is very diversified.  You can eat people, what more do you need?  Oh... this game has had 100+ players consistantly for over a year.

Very, very fun! It is an impressive game for the price, and I absolutely love the feel of this game: basically survive Jurassic Park, lol. The core game is great, and the interactions between human and dinosaurs can lead to some dramatic one-on-one moments. During my first play-through as a human, running along alone, my screen began to shake, thumping with the rythmic beating of ever-closer foot falls. I quickly ducked into a side alley, turning in time to see the leg of a Tyrannosaurus, another live player, running past. After a moment it returned, roaring and thrashing, trying to reach me at the back of the alcove. My gun rang out shot after show along with my screams of equal terror and delight. The beast retreated, returned at an angle anew. My gun clicked out of ammo just as the great reptile's head burst deep into the alcove, pulling me screaming out into the light where it finished me off with one swift gulp. Simply awesome. Its one of those games where you can really find yourself immersed in the action...or sometimes, lack there of. I spawned during one playthrough, again as a human, deep in the dense woods, far from my other team members. As I treked aimlessly through the for forest in search of someone, anyone, my mind raced with thoughts of what foul things may be stalking me from behind or even above. It's moments like this that make this game great. It is not without its flaws however, including some rendering issues from time to time and other assorted bugs, but overall, I am well pleased and would whole-heartedly recommend it.
Great game. Humans VS. Dinos. Kill or be killed. Which side wins... You decide.

Do you like Team Fortress 2? Do you like dinosaurs? Now the most important question...Do you like TF2 with dinosaurs? If the answer is yes, then this game is right up your alley. You can play as either the human team or the dinosaur team each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Both teams have to work together to annihilate the other. This game is skill based and not you generic FPS shooter. Each dino and human class works differently and each class has a strength or weakness against the other. T-rexes being weak against Commando rocket launchers for example however knowing the weaknesses will only get you so far in this game. You have to learn to use your environment against the enemy, work together, and learn from your mistakes to get good at this game. I bought this game for 5 bucks and it was definitely worth the price I feel like I got more with the money I paid for. If you like games like Left 4 Dead multiplayer and Team Fortress 2 then you will be pleasantly surprised with this little original and well put together gem of a game.
Decent frag fest game. Lacking in the no unlocks or leveling system departments. They said there will be new features added at later dates. Overall good gaming experience though.
If you don't mind being eaten alive by a giant lizard, this is a game for you.
The only thing I wish this game had, was a campaign mode similar to left for dead. Thats pretty much what you have here, but in team deathmatch style instead.
Besides some balancing issues and really gimmicky gameplay, Primal Carnage is a suprisingly fun asymmetrical shooter. Give it a try when it goes on sale.

Increadible game!

A fast paced multiplayer shooter that is a lot of fun. Choose a side, humans vs. dinosaurs. The graphics are okay (last generation). For the cheap price on a Steam sale, it is worth it for some mindless, shooting fun. It's a more-modern version of Half-life with dinosaurs, capture points, and more.

The game can be fun, but certian thing ruin it. Every single time I play the game, it rotates between the sme two maps. On the one where I am a dino, there are so many perfect places for humans to camp. On the one where I am a human, its the perfect place for the flying dinos to insta kill you in less than 2 seconds. Everytime I play the game, my side gets no kills, and just about every player on the other team gets at leats 15 kills. I don't really think the game is bad, but it really hates my guts.

RAWAAAARRRR let's do it !!!!! Buy this game is awesome !!!

This game is pretty sick. All the people here are just madcuzbad.  I read things like ''once a dinosaur is near you your pretty sure dead'', which is abolutely not true. A Rex, for example, is not manouverable, so you can just jump to the sides and try to outrun them at edges. Raptors are quick but if you focus you'll get them quite easily, same with pterodactyls and the spitting dudes. The dinos with the horns (Carnotaurus? Allosaurus? idk man) are also avoidable with the same tactic as with the rex. The problem is that people come here expecting a CoD with dinosaurs, but that's not what this is. Of course if you camp on a rock or walk out alone you're going to die, there's literally carnivourus dinosaurs out there you idiot. All the dinos have special abilities activated by them roaring and rex can tilt it's head up and down to get enemies above them and on the ground. The survivors are definetely not in a disadvantage, you just have to stay in packs and you will have the upper hand. a couple of pathfinders, trappers and some black, brollic machine guy dudes and you can easily take down a rex.  Considering this, anyone that has given a bad review should definetely give it another shot, just don't expect a CoD or a Battlefield, this is Primal Carnage.
